summary: The documents describe a mortgage transaction involving a husband and wife residing in New York and Croush-Walker Company (also referred to as ROUSH-WALKER Company) of Atlanta, Georgia. The mortgage, dated March 2, 1978, secures a debt of $167,429.88 against the property located at 163 East 71st Street, New York, NY. A memorandum indicates that this mortgage was part of a CIA-devised facility arrangement, with Roush-Walker Company acting as a nominee. The classified document acknowledges the CIA link to the facility.
significance: The mortgage is significant because it appears to be linked to a CIA-devised facility, with Croush-Walker Company acting as a nominee. This suggests a potential connection between the property and covert CIA activities, which may be relevant in the context of the JFK assassination depending on the nature of the CIA's involvement and the purpose of the facility.
